required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose-Response Study of MR-107A-01 in The Treatment of Post-Surgical Dental Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Dose-Response Study of MR-107A-01 in The Treatment of Post-Surgical Dental Pain

brief_summary.textblock: MR-107A-01 is being studied to investigate its efficacy, safety, and dose-response after dental surgery.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity Using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: 10 point scale, where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Relief Using a Numeric Scale
secondary_outcome.description: 5 point scale, where 0 is poor, 1 is fair, 2 is good, 3 is very good, and 4 is excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's Global Assessment of Pain Control
secondary_outcome.description: 5 point scale, where 0 is poor, 1 is fair, 2 is good, 3 is very good, and 4 is excellent

arm_group.arm_group_label: MR-107A-01 15 mg once in a 24-hour period
arm_group.description: Oral tablet one day of dosing

arm_group.arm_group_label: MR-107A-01 10 mg once in a 24-hour period
arm_group.description: Oral tablet one day of dosing

arm_group.arm_group_label: MR-107A-01 15 mg twice in a 24-hour period
arm_group.description: Oral tablet one day of dosing

arm_group.arm_group_label: MR-107A-01 10 mg twice in a 24-hour period
arm_group.description: Oral tablet one day of dosing
Placebo tablet one day of dosing

intervention.arm_group_label: MR-107A-01 10 mg once in a 24-hour period
MR-107A-01 10 mg twice in a 24-hour period
MR-107A-01 15 mg once in a 24-hour period
MR-107A-01 15 mg twice in a 24-hour period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Males and females ≥18 years of age.
2. Requirement for dental surgery for extraction of ≥2 x third molars, at least 1 of which involves partial or complete mandibular bony impaction.
3. Pain Intensity (PI) using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) ≥5 during the 5 hours following the end of surgery.
4. Rating of moderate or severe pain on a 4-point categorical pain rating scale (i.e., none, mild, moderate, severe) during the 5 hours following the end of surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previously dosed with MR-107A-01.
2. Subject with known hypersensitivity to nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).
3. Active GI bleeding or a history of peptic ulcer disease, active inflammatory bowel disease, e.g., Crohn's Disease or ulcerative colitis, bleeding disorders that may affect coagulation.
4. Use of any investigational drug within 28 days, or 5 half-lives, prior to screening whichever is longer.
5. Use of medications with the potential to interact with MR-107A-01.
6. Other acute or chronic medical or psychiatric condition or laboratory abnormality that may increase the risk associated with study participation or investigational product administration or may interfere with the interpretation of study results and, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the subject inappropriate for entry into this study.
